title: Web-Based HTML Coding Learning Course Using Visual Models: Digital Citizenship Competency and Information Representation Structure Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and internet usage experience, foundational understanding of digital environments, and introductory awareness of rights and responsibilities as a societal member
context.additional_context: Delivered in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, this course focuses on understanding HTML structures and debugging through visual models. Learners acquire web-based communication skills as digital society members, develop information producer competencies, and civic engagement awareness. Stresses content creation reflecting social values (digital rights, online etiquette, cultural diversity).

learning_goals: Learners can connect HTML tags and web page output results with 80% accuracy using visual models (diagrams/arrows) and understand information representation structures and civic engagement methods in digital society.

Learners can complete provided HTML assignments (e.g., basic page composition) in a simulation environment within 3 attempts, achieving â‰¥70% accuracy in error correction, thereby cultivating digital problem-solving skills and technical adaptability.

Learners can independently produce a 2-page static web page (including headers, body text, and images) through project-based assessment, demonstrating creative expression skills as digital citizens and cultural communication competencies.

resources: HTML debugging practice sample code set
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
